Line 20: Line 20:
==Overview==
==Overview==
â
The Pandora system will have an [[open source]], [[Linux]]-based OS. The Pandora is designed to be a handheld game console, with [[PDA]] capabilities.
+
The Pandora system will have an [[open source]], [[Linux]]-based [[operating system|OS]]. The Pandora is designed to be a handheld game console, with [[PDA]] capabilities.
One of the main uses of the Pandora is for homebrew gaming and the emulation of older computer systems and video game consoles, which is possible through efficient use of the resources made available by the [[Texas Instruments]] [[OMAP|OMAP 3530]] [[system-on-a-chip|SoC]]. The Pandora developers has already shown working emulators for [[PlayStation]], [[Amiga]], and [[Sega Mega Drive]] software,<Ref name="Pandora developer blog">[http://openpandora.org/blog.php]</ref> and the Pandora is thought by its developers to have the potential to emulate most if not all machines older than the PlayStation (notably including the [[Super Nintendo Entertainment System|Super NES]], the [[Nintendo Entertainment System]], and the [[Atari Jaguar]]).<ref name="Official 'semi-speculative' emulator list">[http://www.gp32x.com/board/index.php?showtopic=41897 Official 'semi-speculative' emulator list]</ref> The Pandora's keyboard and touchscreen should allow interaction with [[Commodore 64]], [[ZX Spectrum]], [[MSX]], [[Atari ST]] and other classic home computer emulators.
One of the main uses of the Pandora is for homebrew gaming and the emulation of older computer systems and video game consoles, which is possible through efficient use of the resources made available by the [[Texas Instruments]] [[OMAP|OMAP 3530]] [[system-on-a-chip|SoC]]. The Pandora developers has already shown working emulators for [[PlayStation]], [[Amiga]], and [[Sega Mega Drive]] software,<Ref name="Pandora developer blog">[http://openpandora.org/blog.php]</ref> and the Pandora is thought by its developers to have the potential to emulate most if not all machines older than the PlayStation (notably including the [[Super Nintendo Entertainment System|Super NES]], the [[Nintendo Entertainment System]], and the [[Atari Jaguar]]).<ref name="Official 'semi-speculative' emulator list">[http://www.gp32x.com/board/index.php?showtopic=41897 Official 'semi-speculative' emulator list]</ref> The Pandora's keyboard and touchscreen should allow interaction with [[Commodore 64]], [[ZX Spectrum]], [[MSX]], [[Atari ST]] and other classic home computer emulators.
